name: Doing Andy v1
description: Keep the corp poor. Get out your breakers. Have Fun :)

name: Doing Andy v2
Marked for Stall 1.1
description:
Basically, the idea is to screw with the runner, then fast advance. If you can get Datapool out, you can just drain 4 credits a turn from the runner, or get a free tag.

Could turn into a tag n' bag, but I don't really like it. Economy is dodgy unless you can get at least one of the Adonises, or a Marked Accounts.

name: Exiled Faerie 3.0
description:
Faerie recursion, To use as super economic running, so pressure can be applied unexpectedly and when its needed.

The plan is to get in to anything, but only a few times. Hence Makers Eye rather than RDI and a few others...

Yes, not having plascrete has killed me, but I dont want to drop something to theme just to counter something that might come up

Decided on exile rather than kate because there are so few cards to get discounts on, and so much recursion.

A comment suggested I add in Shefluglebuster as it can turn the not discounts from kate into a bit of cash from all the 0 cost programs and recursion. Like the idea, went with it and decided to change the rest of the econ around a little as well.

Since I have noticed this deck needs big hunks of money now and then more than trickles of money to keep running every turn. Hopefully this will let me use big money with Femme to break later Sentries when I have run out of Faeries to recur.

name: Α / Ω v1.0
description:
It's been a while since I last played a Chaos Theory deck, but with Alpha and Omega, the little Wünderkind might actually be the best Identity for this kind of deck.

When you have A&O installed, no server can be secure with less than 3 pieces of ICE. If they do have 3 or more, though, there is no way to pass, unless you either install other IBs or find a different solution.

This deck offers a few solutions: 1 - Parasites and/or Kraken to simply trash them; 2 - Crypsis, expensive and time consuming, but reliable; 3 - Escher, to rearrange them.

Most of the time, though, you should just go for option number 1, since the deck is built around that. Grimoire, Surge, Datasucker and ICE Carver are all cards helping you to destroy them as fast as possible. And Personal Workshop, together with Clone Chip and Self-modifying Code, can have them pop up mid-run, for the Corp's displeasure.

name: Whizzard does Oldschool v1.2
description:
Money and Breakers. Pure as heaven, efficient as hell. Try to get to late game fast! - v1.0: Start

  • v1.1: Reconfiguration after input from Sebbes and Darkpact. Made 12/22 at the Strassbourg Store Championship on 16.02.14

-v1.2 minor changes.

name: Reina Roja's Big Money v2.1
description: Virus breakers + economy control.

name: Good News
Amazon Sys Admins
description:
Set up huge towers with Amazon industrial grid and Akitaro.

Then swap out the ice as needed with Midori.

Still considering if I should be running Gila or Unothodox Predictions in this. I am a little worried about economy. But with all the 3 pointers, a unbreakable turn could be amazing.

Predictions are difficult to time effectively for 3 pointers though, they work great with Nisei though.

name: HB wins version H
description: Foxfire is Subliminal Messaging Green Level Clearance is Blue Level Clearance

name: Red Aggression
description:
Playing Reina decks I found that focusing too much on credit denial is dangerous in the long term. In this deck I'm only using 2x Account Siphons, supported by Parasite and Knight to force the Corp to install and rez a lot of ICE. Dèja Vu is a great recursion tool both for Siphon or Parasites.

In the early game 2x Special Order, Parasite+Datasucker and Knight help me in putting pressure to the Corp and prevent easy scores, while a full suit of Yog.0, Corroder and Mimic supported by ICE Carver are great for the late game, because all ICE up to strength 4 can be passed without Datasucker tokens.

The only thing I'm struggling with is the economy: Armitage Codebusting (supported by Sure Gamble and Dirty Laundry) is great for early aggression, but the deck has problems if the game drags on.

name: Cronos Titan of Brain Damage
Spies Like Us
description: im super excited for Silhouette. Here is my take on the rig I would run. Looking for feedback

name: Little Criminal
description:
Minimal setup and early aggression. Late game surgical strikes.

I reached a 59% win rate with this on the BGG-L03 challenge board (username emlun). I haven't played much since, but the few times I've played with friends lately it's still stood strong.

The core aim of this deck is this: Get exactly what you need, exactly when you need it. Run rigless for as long as possible, and then keep the rig to the minimum required for the task at hand.

Minimal setup allows for a lot of early aggression, which together with strategic use of Account Siphon keeps the corp just poor enough to prevent them from rezzing important ICE. I rarely have a full breaker suite out with this deck.

Money is tight by design, so make sure every run counts. Indexing and/or The Maker's Eye let you see a large chunk of R&D on a moment's notice.

Once some ICE is up and/or money is needed, tutor up Magnum Opus with Test Run+Scavenge and drop a Self-Modifying Code. Femme Fatale loves Test Run and Scavenge. SMC + Clone Chip + Faerie + Crescentus is a nice surprise for when the corp rezzes that big ICE (Archer! :D) you indexed earlier.

In summary, the play style is a mix of Criminal and Shaper strategies - dodge ICE as much as possible, but have efficient breakers and economy for when it's needed. I like to think of it as a "surgical strike" deck - it won't always get in anywhere, but with some planning it'll often stretch just enough to get you in where you need to.

This deck gets into trouble if there are a lot of high-strength Sentries out. The game plan in general is to use Femme Fatale to bypass big ice with few subroutines, and use/recur Crescentus to derez the expensive ones after breaking them only once.

Don't get tagged unless you're sure there's no Scorched Earth around.

name: Dino is a hacker final version
description:
I made some last fixes. I t quess Kate is better for me.

  • I think yog + dinosaurus and datasucker should be enough to break everything what is code gate. So I delted Torch from this deck.

  • Total MU6-2 from Dino.

  • Second thing about Im now sure is Profesional Contacts.

  • Eureka was too expensive so I splashed Retrieval Run. Will be much cheaper and better.

We will see,

name: GRNDL throws money on your corpse 2.0
description: Updated

name: The Pandora Box
description:
Tennin Institute – the Pandora Box of our Jinteki Corporation. Rumor has it that within it lies many dangerous, cut-edge experiments that serves to leave one traumatized and mentally damaged.

What truly drives such an economical draining research facility is the monetary gift from our own celebrity, the annoying pop-up window advertisement funded by NBN and our very own pioneer project- the Sundew.

Under the fierce and aggressive direction of our Chairman Hiro, our runner will feel short-handed unless he is able to somehow remove his overwhelming influence. Even without our Executive’s direction, Mushin No Shin will serve to speed up our advancement with assets or agendas. This works greatly with the Institute’s special focus area, the ability to advance whenever the runner does not make a successful run. With these, we are able to summon our loyal Ronin swiftly to deal great damage on our runner or open our secret house of knives quickly to be able to deal out deadly damage. The trick of light allows us to better reallocate these advancement tokens for quick advance strategy in case the runner is pressuring.

Should the runner be brave to enter the deep layers of the Tennin Institute, he will find himself getting Shock!, Snare!, falling off the edge of the world, or if he is lucky enough, meeting our secret Fetal AI, assuming he survives our knives from the secret house, gets pass our wall of thorns or the denotation of our mines. About to access our servers, too bad, you not going to find out what lies within it when we have our Nisei MKII. The loyalty of Zaibatsu clans will also protect our dirty little secrets from those pesky exposure and don’t forget to launch the neural EMP counter-attack on our runner after he attempts to sneak around our servers.

What secret will you find laying around in the deserted branch of our Jinteki Corporation?

name: Consummate Professional

description: Jinteki toolbox Don't search to kill just slow down and demotived the runner ...

name: NBN Knows
Atman Deck V2
Atman Deck V2
Remote Frustration
description:
Most Jinteki decks I've seen and played have revolved around traps, bluffing, and net damage.

My problem with these decks is that deck traps feel too random and installed traps take too much investment for potentially no effect (and playing a Trick of Light deck puts you even further behind).

Remote Frustration plays around setting up a massive set of remote servers filled with valuable assets and protecting your centrals with taxing ice. "Taxing" not only refers to credits, but also clicks and cards. Run those runners ragged trying to hit your remotes and giving them minimum time to build their rig.

Agendas: Mostly standard stuff. False leads can lead to Nisei's and both add to the runner's frustration. Priority Req for the few piece of moderately expensive ice we have.

Assets:

Lots of economic assets. Sundews are obviously one of the strongest and you'll want to protect with at least a simple ETR. PADs can be left naked since they're costly to trash. The aggressive secretary is a nice surprise for when you can get the game to match point. I didn't say I totally disregarded the bluff game :)

Upgrade:

Corporate troubleshooters are nice for making ice on your centrals stick. This deck generally has pretty solid economy so you'll be able to pump a piece of ice at a crucial point.

Operations: Celebrity gift is good for econ obviously and since we're not really playing the bluff game the knowledge to the runner is slightly less valuable.

Interns are also great in this deck. Nothing like having runners exhaust themselves trying to hit that Sundew only to install it the very next turn.

Ice:

A decent mix of cheap ETRs, some mid range taxing ice, and some slightly more expensive hitters.

The general rule of thumb is to put the cheap ETRs on your Sundew/Agenda server and your stronger ETR and taxing ice on centrals.

Ichi 1.0 and Uroboros fill kinda the same role (leaky, but heavily taxing ice) and can be swapped for another copy of each other depending on preference. Tsurugi also fills this niche, but can't really be replaced.

Swordsman is a cheaper taxer and can be your ace against AI breakers.

The single Enigma is good to have early when the Yog isn't out and also serves to tax the runner so they can't run your remotes.

Potential Changes:

Celebrity Gift and Melange fill very similar roles and can be swapped for each other depending on preference.

Tsurugis can be dropped if AIs aren't a huge threat. More cheap ETRs would go in their place (perhaps datapikes or drop the Ichi 1.0/Uro for Rotos).

Many thanks to the contributors of this Reddit Thread: http://www.reddit.com/r/Netrunner/comments/1ygokr/nonbluffing_jinteki/
